data.name: Slide0Description
data.value: This is the presentation of the Blind Signature Generator. Blind signatures are a special type of digital signatures which allow a high degree of anonymity and yet can be used for verification of messages.

data.name: Slide0Values
data.value: Please run the generator and then click through the steps to be shown the internal calculations of the component.

data.name: Slide1Description
data.value: In the first step the component reads your input and registers it.

data.name: Slide1Values0
data.value: Values:

data.name: Slide1Values1
data.value: The input of your message (M) is:

data.name: Slide1Values2
data.value: The input of your modulo (N) is:

data.name: Slide1Values3
data.value: The input of your public key (E/G)is:

data.name: Slide1Values4
data.value: The input of your private key (D/Lambda) is:

data.name: Slide2Description
data.value: In the second step the component the component converts your message to a byte[] and uses the hash algorithm you have chosen in the settings.

data.name: Slide2Values
data.value: Your message has now become:

data.name: Slide3DescriptionPaillier1
data.value: In the third step the component blinds the message for the paillier signing algorithm.

data.name: Slide3DescriptionPaillier2
data.value: For this a blindingfactor k is randomly generated and used to blind the message with M* = M * k^N

data.name: Slide3DescriptionRSA1
data.value: In the third step the component blinds the message for the RSA signing algorithm.

data.name: Slide3DescriptionRSA2
data.value: For this a blindingfactor k is randomly generated and used to blind the message with M* = M * k^E mod N

data.name: Slide3ValuesPaillier1
data.value: k:

data.name: Slide3ValuesRSA1
data.value: k:

data.name: Slide3ValuesRSA2
data.value: Blinded message M*:

data.name: Slide4DescriptionPaillier1
data.value: In the fourth step the component starts the pallier signing algorithm.

data.name: Slide4DescriptionPaillier2
data.value: For that the two signature values s1 and s2 for the paillier algorithm are calculated with

data.name: Slide4DescriptionPaillier3
data.value: s1 = (L(M^Lambda mod N^2) / L(G^Lambda mod N^2)) mod N

data.name: Slide4DescriptionPaillier4
data.value: s2 = (M * G^-s1)^(1/N mod lambda) mod N

data.name: Slide4DescriptionPaillier5
data.value: At last the signature is un-blinded by multiplying s2 with k^-1 mod N

data.name: Slide4DescriptionRSA1
data.value: In the fourth step the component starts the RSA signing algorithm.

data.name: Slide4DescriptionRSA2
data.value: For this the signature s is calculated with s = M^D mod N

data.name: Slide4DescriptionRSA3
data.value: At last the signature is un-blinded by dividing s by k

data.name: Slide4ValuesRSA1
data.value: k:

data.name: Slide4ValuesRSA2
data.value: s:

data.value: Message M publicly visible

data.name: PublicMessageTooltip
data.value: Input of your Message to be publicly announced

data.name: SlideStep

data.name: BlindSigningSecurityTooltip
data.value: Choose the security level against blind signing attacks.
